commit.message:
Merge pull request #10 from davedoesdev/issue-9-decode-after-split

Issue #9 Decode later, to avoid decoding in the middle of utf8 sequence

Issue #9 Decode later, to avoid decoding in the middle of utf8 sequence

And to make sure we only split on \r and \n (Unicode splitlines splits on a
number of other characters which is not in the SSE spec)
Bump to version 1.5

Correctly parse empty data lines

A bug in the data field parsing lead to incorrectly swallowing empty
data lines; we were not correctly following the EventSource spec:

  If the field name is "data":
  Append the field value to the data buffer, then append a single
  U+000A LINE FEED (LF) character to the data buffer.

Dispatch last chunk correctly

The chunk reading method had a bug that would lead it to not dispatch
the last chunk of data from the event source if the stream did not end
with an empty new line.
Provide example with python-requests (fixes #5)
Provide installation instructions via Pip

Merge pull request #4 from ticosax/point-to-pypi

Give a link to pypi resource
Give a link to pypi resource
Bump version to 1.4

Merge pull request #3 from altaurog/unicode

Decode to Python 3 str type

Merge pull request #2 from altaurog/noblock

Noblock
Decode to Python 3 str type
Iterate _event_source directly, without .stream()
Document need for preload_content=False, no .stream()

Stitch chunks into full valid events

It's unfortunately possible for events to spread across multiple HTTP
chunks in a chunked-encoded response. We have to be careful when reading
the streamed chunked response as the end of the chunk might not be the
end of an event.

We have to look for the event delimiter (empty new line) and stitch back
together consecutive chunks into individual events as/when necessary.

Signed-off-by: Maxime Petazzoni <maxime.petazzoni@bulix.org>

Correctly close underlying connection

Signed-off-by: Maxime Petazzoni <maxime.petazzoni@bulix.org>

Allow for manually closing the response stream
